title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

10:26 <ralucaM> Hello! Is there a way to obtain statistics for XWiki Workspace?  
10:28 <vmassol> myxwiki.org seems completely down  
10:28 <vmassol> ralucaM: it's built on top of XE I believe so you can get XE stats  
10:28 <vmassol> xwiki workspaces has been abandonned a long time ago btw  
10:28 <vmassol> it's no longer supported by the xwiki dev team  
10:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <ralucaM> so it's just "Statistics Application" which is bundled with XE  
10:33 <vmassol> ralucaM: you could ask jerome velocity if he's coded anything else at the time  
10:33 <vmassol> velociter :)  
10:33 <vmassol> (my fingers were thinking by themselves)

11:49 <+cjdelisle> I'm thinking about dropping support for filesystem attachment automatically failing over to the db attachment system if it can't find an attachment. It's fragile and a bit of a hack to provide smooth transition but it becomes complex with deleted attachments where one might ask for all deleted attachments for a given document. WDYT?  
11:50 <+cjdelisle> The alternative is a groovy script which moves attachments over.  
11:51 <+cjdelisle> And I think that is safer too since the user will never be deleting anything from the db unless they are switched to db attachment mode.

12:35 <+cjdelisle> Just built xwiki-core with forkMode commented out and <argLine>-Xmx128M</argLine>  
12:35 <+cjdelisle> Apparently that memory leak was fixed for maven3.  
12:36 <+cjdelisle> mvn -o clean install  
12:36 <vmassol> 3.0.3?  
12:36 <+cjdelisle> [INFO] Total time: 1:10.538s  
12:36 <+cjdelisle> Apache Maven 3.0.1-SNAPSHOT (rNON-CANONICAL\_2010-10-04\_23-13\_user; 2010-10-04 23:13:29-0400)  
12:41 <+cjdelisle> Another thing, you can get a massive speed increase by building WYSIWYG threaded.  
12:42 <+cjdelisle> Maybe not safe enough to release that way but I would do it for CI.  
12:53 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <gsauthier> Hi all  
13:07 <gsauthier> Maybe not on the right channel but I have a access rights related question ...  
13:07 <gsauthier> I want to have a space viewable by everyone, but editable only by people in a group  
13:08 <gsauthier> when I change the access rights of the space (set edit permission on my group), non logged users seems to have no more the right to simply view the page ...  
13:09 <vmassol> gsauthier:  
13:09 <vmassol> that's normal  
13:10 <vmassol> when no rights is set for a given permissions it means it's allowed  
13:10 <vmassol> (allowed for everyone)  
13:10 <vmassol> if you click on edit for a given group  
13:10 <vmassol> then you need to also set it to all other users who need it  
13:10 <gsauthier> ohhh, so, if I uncheck the view permission for my group it should work ?  
13:10 <vmassol> s/users/groups/  
13:10 <vmassol> yes  
13:10 <vmassol> if you don't have it set for any group it'll work  
13:11 <gsauthier> Yeah, that works !!  
13:11 <gsauthier> thanks vincent  
13:11 <vmassol> np  
13:13 <gsauthier> Cool, we now have group security on the OW2 TC pages :) http://www.ow2.org/view/TechnologyCouncil/  
13:14 <vmassol> cool  
13:15 <gsauthier> I really like much more the new XWiki (2.x) than pre 1.0 :) So much improvements !!!  
13:15 <vmassol> glad you like it :)  
13:15 <vmassol> 3.0 is around the corner too  
13:15 <vmassol> (well the first version of it)  
13:16 <vmassol> as always  
13:16 <vmassol> :)  
13:19 <gsauthier> I just had some issues with blogs: somehow, in ow2, the old blog classes (XWiki.ArticleClass) are still in use where we should use Blog.BlogPostClass ... Don't know if this comes from the Blog plugin or some OW2 legacy ...  
13:19 <vmassol> gsauthier: we have a migrator  
13:19 <vmassol> you just need to go to the Blog.Migrations page  
13:19 <vmassol> Blog.Migration  
13:20 <gsauthier> cool, i'll tell that to our admin  
13:20 <gsauthier> I don't want to press the death button myself ;)  
13:20 <vmassol> hehe  
13:21 <vmassol> make sure you have a backup first as always  
13:21 <gsauthier> sure  
13:21 <gsauthier> thanks for all theses interesting info  
13:21 <gsauthier> as always, the xwiki community is very reactive ...  
13:22 <vmassol> we try….  
13:23 <abusenius> has quit  
14:00 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:16 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:18 <vmassol> hmm what do we do of old branches/tags for modules moved to common? for example http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/pom/  
14:27 <vmassol> so our average time is 14 weeks to fix bugs in XWiki platform/core: https://programeter.com/projectgrader/xwiki-core-1  
14:27 <vmassol> could do better....  
14:30 <+cjdelisle> That is a bad metric because there are usually 2 types of bugs. 1. I found a problem I will report, fix, close. These last a day. 2. User doesn't like something complains; hard problem, api break needed or nobody considers it worth fixing but nobody wishes to claim it is frivolous and close as "won't fix", these sit on the tracker forever.  
14:32 <DrLou> has quit  
14:36 <vmassol> cjdelisle: see my last tweets on http://twitter.com/vmassol  
14:38 <vmassol> starting the move of observation-api  
14:44 <+cjdelisle> Yup. When the data is peaked on the low and high ends a good trick is to compare the mean to the median. If the median is lower then you are doing well, if higher then you are losing. OFC you only get a binary output from that metric since the median will most likely be very low or very high.  
14:47 <+jvelociter> ":yep  
14:48 <+jvelociter> wrong chan  
14:53 <sburjan> has quit  
15:02 <esdaniel> no one want to answer the question about RSS feed of tagged pages? :-(  
15:08 <+cjdelisle> I can try but you'll have to refresh my memory.  
15:10 <+cjdelisle> "make xwiki more easily reusable by other projects to spread the brand: that's what we're doing with XWiki Rendering and XWiki Commons" :)  
15:12 <+cjdelisle> I have looked at a number of projects which would fail our checkstyle validator miserably so we really have a lot to brag about.  
15:16 <esdaniel> cjdelisle: thanks... xwiki offers feature to render rss feed based on page tags, when i tag pages and then check the rss tag feed i get all pages - so does it not work or?  
15:17 <+cjdelisle> I don't know anything about that feature but if you can tell me exactly what you are entering to get that rss feed, I can look at the code and get you an answer.  
15:18 <esdaniel> cjdelisle: http://www.choreos.eu/bin/Main/WebRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&tag=RSS  
15:18 <+lucaa> esdaniel: I think last time I checked that it was working fine  
15:18 <+lucaa> but I cannot tell you more and I don't have time to debug with you as I need to go now  
15:18 <esdaniel> lucaa - np, c'est la vie  
15:19 <lucaa> has quit  
15:19 <esdaniel> cjdelisle: the only pages tagged are calendar, interviews and 'news and events' - so not sure why it gives me everything  
15:20 <esdaniel> cjdelisle: s/not sure/no clue  
15:22 <+cjdelisle> Repeated on local. tag=RSS should only return documents with the RSS tag correct?  
15:28 <+cjdelisle> argh, feel like introducing an error so I can just read the stacktrace  
15:29 <esdaniel> cjdelisle - yes, correct - that was my assumption  
15:37 <+cjdelisle> http://www.choreos.eu/bin/view/Main/TagsRss?xpage=plain&outputSyntax=plain&tag=RSS  
15:37 <esdaniel> aha, you clever chap!  
15:38 <+cjdelisle> WebRSS <-- recently modified pages  
15:38 <+cjdelisle> TagsRss <-- rss feed by tag.  
15:38 <+cjdelisle> What is choreos about? It looks interesting but the terminology is baffeling to me.  
15:39 <esdaniel> i copied the link from the tag's page (rss icon)  
15:39 <esdaniel> choreos - quite easy to explain, a bugger to realise... heard of service orchestration?  
15:40 <esdaniel> simply - the orchestration of services  
15:40 <+cjdelisle> Similar to cloud computing but on a different level?  
15:40 <esdaniel> it's kind of a push/pull hub and spoke affair really... where as choreographies are more sequences that play out during indeterminate periods  
15:41 <esdaniel> so you can have a domino / ripple effect like the weather that causes all sorts of things to change / update  
15:42 <esdaniel> to map that in a way that a domain expert can model is not possible with just service orchestration, too many unknowns / dependencies  
15:42 <esdaniel> the idea of choreographies is to provide that ability to model and design for those use cases  
15:42 <+cjdelisle> Ok so this is about many services which are interrelated where cloud is many services which are independent?  
15:42 <+cjdelisle> (AKA every site in the cloud knows nothing about other sites in the cloud)  
15:43 <esdaniel> choreographies supercede cloud  
15:44 <esdaniel> if you imagine cloud #1 internet, then cloud #2 private clouds and then cloud #3 hybrids - imagine a model that crossed, influenced and interacted with #1, #2 ,#3  
15:44 <esdaniel> each of #1/2/3 has 100s to millions of potential services a choreography could interact with  
15:44 <esdaniel> it's worth reading the use-case on the site here:  
15:45 <esdaniel> http://www.choreos.eu/bin/Discover/PeopleCoordination  
15:45 <+cjdelisle> I scanned over the site looking for a concrete use case.  
15:46 <esdaniel> i'll be posting a discussion on choreography to the blog real soon, i'll ping you when its live  
15:46 <esdaniel> meanwhile, this doc might also interest: http://www.choreos.eu/bin/download/Download/Collateral/CHOReOSWP1D1.1StateoftheArtBaselineandBeyondVA.0.pdf  
15:47 <+cjdelisle> yup that's the future  
15:47 <esdaniel> indeed  
15:48 <+cjdelisle> I've been talking about it by other names. Like the idea of a cooperative blacklisting service where multiple sites can participate in excluding spam and scraper ips. 1 central service which serves a tiny niche.  
15:49 <+cjdelisle> Web services which are primarily consumed by other servers.  
15:49 <+cjdelisle> (That's probably just one application)  
15:52 <esdaniel> cjdelisle: we share similar thinking, i gotta hack some ruby scripts to be called from fail2ban/snort as per this: http://securitysauce.blogspot.com/2009/05/ip-blacklisting-for-snort-2841.html#c3708470947841333777  
15:53 <esdaniel> one of my tasks for my day-off / journee repos if i ever find the damn time!  
15:54 <+cjdelisle> this is ridiculous, everyone I know has some sort of blacklisting system on their box. It is probably the most clear case for choreography right now.  
15:54 <esdaniel> it's already been done and commercialized per se, but there's not really a widespread defacto community standard implementation out-of-the-box that one can just apt/yum/pacman to install  
15:55 <esdaniel> it would certainly be a great tool against all -ve net behaviour out there - boxes attacked post, meanwhile auto-blacklists subscribe to the hashtag  
15:56 <+cjdelisle> What I'm thinking is: too many page loads too fast --> redirect to a captcha.  
15:57 <esdaniel> maybe, an algo that takes that and other data and decides whether to jail the IP or not even better  
15:57 <+cjdelisle> As a webmaster you subscribe to whatever level of page loads per minute per ip you want and users will be blocked for you when they pull more than that number of pages from anyone.  
15:57 <+cjdelisle> (from any subscriber)  
15:57 <+cjdelisle> That means a web bug  
15:58 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
15:58 <esdaniel> someone's probably done that as an apache plugin  
15:58 <+cjdelisle> And the web bug creates a cryptographic token in each link and all you (the webmaster) need to do is validate the token when you get a hit. If the validation fails you redirect to the blacklisting server.  
15:59 <+cjdelisle> Blacklisting server checks the ip and if they are not listed then it redirects them back (double redirect for people with js turned off)  
16:00 <+cjdelisle> It might be made faster with dns magic but dns is dangerous, mistakes take a couple days to clear out.  
16:02 <esdaniel> for now i'd be just happy with box being able to post to statusnet and subscribe to hashtag and auto-ban, thereafter one might evolve it further  
16:02 <esdaniel> hashtag is a bit like a p2p tracker  
16:03 <+cjdelisle> hehe recycle bittorrent tracker tech.  
16:03 <esdaniel> cjdelisle: don't suppose you know the script that tells me orphans of users not in groups, excluding xwiki-all per chance?  
16:04 <+cjdelisle> users who are in no group hmm  
16:06 <nuvolari\_> has quit  
16:12 <+cjdelisle> $xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject as user, BaseObject as group, BaseProperty as member where user.name = doc.fullName and user.className = 'XWiki.XWikiUsers' and group.className = 'XWiki.XWikiGroups' and group.name != 'XWiki.XWikiAllGroup' and member.id = group.id and member.value = doc.fullName and member.name = 'member'")  
16:12 <+cjdelisle> I think  
16:19 <rrodriguez> has quit  
16:20 <esdaniel> i wonder if anyone's created an eclipse plugin for hacking xwiki velocity code to avoid common typo pitfalls  
16:23 <vmassol> ok I have to leave for a while…. next step will be to move shared tests to commons
